title: Easing the daily grind with these awesome JDK command line tools
description:
Included in the JDK installation are a lot of handy tools for Java developers, from java itself to jshell, jcmd, jfr, jlink and jdeprscan. These allow you to analyse a running JVM, generate JRE's, run Java source code and much more. In this talk I would like to present a number of these tools with practical examples and thus expand the toolbox of the participants.

Async profiler, jbang and sdkman are not part of the JDK but too useful to ignore.



With the command line tools, many tasks can be automated and executed more efficiently, leaving more time for the exciting things in developer life.
